intro: Dischisma erinoides, commonly known as the silverleaf dischisma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, silver-gray leaves that help reduce water loss, and it produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and drought tolerance. Dischisma erinoides is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
